thread.title: Lea Michele Admits It Took 'A Lot of Work' to Move on After Cory Monteith's Death
thread.title_full: Lea Michele Admits It Took 'A Lot of Work' to Move on After Cory Monteith's Death

title: Lea Michele Admits It Took 'A Lot of Work' to Move on After Cory Monteith's Death
text:
Entertainment Lea Michele Admits It Took 'A Lot of Work' to Move on After Cory Monteith's Death Posted just a moment ago 
ABC/Fred Lee (NEW YORK) -- Lea Michele was devastated when Cory Monteith, her Glee co-star and boyfriend of more than a year, died in 2013. Moving forward, she said, "was a struggle." 
"Getting to the other side takes a lot of work. All you can do is get to the other side," Michele tells Marie Claire for its November cover story. "When you do, there is happiness there. It’s important to me to keep private some of that process with how I got here. But I am here, I am good, and I am very grateful for that." 
Monteith was 31 when he was found dead in a Vancouver hotel room July 13, 2013. Authorities later revealed he died of mixed drug toxicity involving heroin and alcohol. 
In 2014, Michele began dating Matthew Paetz. 
The Scream Queens star also tells Marie Claire the ordeal helped her become more confident. "Everybody thinks you’re a star with roses being dropped at your feet. You have to take some f*
